column4: hey need help when i do sudo apt-get upgrade , it connect to 192.168.0.1:3128 ( which is my old proxy) i removed it from system/Preference/Proxy ! but still same !? iis there any config need to remove too? Thanks
ap-get has its own proxy sttings
then when i do it give: Could not connect to 192.168.0.1:3128 (192.168.0.1). - connect (113 No route to host)
how i can change this to default automatic?
if the proxy setting is stll present for apt-get it will stil try to use it
where i can check proxy settings for apt?
didn't find proxy there! where i can find it?
using Synaptic Package manager, there is also no proxy! then why it give me like that?
ok but my connection doesn't require proxy and in this file got DPkg::Pre-Install-Pkgs {"/usr/sbin/dpkg-preconfigure --apt || true";}; only? what should i use ? export http_proxy only ?

i used http_proxy= and worked ! one more thing why my clock on ubuntu is differ from windows i set ubuntu clock : 12:45 on windows will be 3:45 and if i set windows, ubuntu's clock will change why ? Thanks
check timezone and/or change the time mnually
i use this : hwclock --systohc ( after this execute, the problem come!
